articles.headline: ‘It Was Horror’: Ukrainians Share Grim Tales of Russian Occupation
articles.snippet: With Russian soldiers pushed out of parts of the Kharkiv region, Ukrainian investigators have been overwhelmed with accounts of detentions, torture and missing relatives, as well as collaboration and property theft.
articles.abstract: With Russian soldiers pushed out of parts of the Kharkiv region, Ukrainian investigators have been overwhelmed with accounts of detentions, torture and missing relatives, as well as collaboration and property theft.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALAKLIYA, Ukraine — Russian troops spent weeks searching for Mariya, the 65-year-old common-law wife of a serving Ukrainian Army officer.
articles.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Ivor Prickett

articles.headline: How Disinformation Splintered and Became More Intractable
articles.snippet: Ahead of the midterm elections, the proliferation of alternative social media sites has helped cement false and misleading information as a defining feature of American politics.
articles.abstract: Ahead of the midterm elections, the proliferation of alternative social media sites has helped cement false and misleading information as a defining feature of American politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the morning of July 8, former President Donald J. Trump took to Truth Social, a social media platform he founded with people close to him, to claim that he had in fact won the 2020 presidential vote in Wisconsin, despite all evidence to the contrary.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Sheera Frenkel

articles.headline: Truss Defied the Markets, and They Ruthlessly Sealed Her Fate
articles.snippet: World leaders buffeted by economic challenges are watching the turmoil in Britain with anything but relish, hoping that Liz Truss’s woes won’t be a harbinger for other countries.
articles.abstract: World leaders buffeted by economic challenges are watching the turmoil in Britain with anything but relish, hoping that Liz Truss’s woes won’t be a harbinger for other countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For Liz Truss, the end came on Thursday in a midday meeting with grandees of the Conservative Party. But Ms. Truss’s fate as prime minister was all but sealed three weeks earlier when currency and bond traders reacted to her new fiscal program by torpedoing the pound and other British financial assets.

articles.headline: Are We Past Peak Newsletter?
articles.snippet: The humble email newsletter, which became a star in its own right, appears headed back to earth.
articles.abstract: The humble email newsletter, which became a star in its own right, appears headed back to earth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Meta, which owns Facebook, is killing Bulletin, its newsletter product. Substack, a much-ballyhooed newsletter start-up, has cut back on advances to writers. The Atlantic is retooling its newsletter deals with writers.
articles.byline: By Benjamin Mullin and Katie Robertson

articles.headline: Liz Truss Resigns After 6 Chaotic Weeks, Igniting New Leadership Fight
articles.snippet: The beleaguered British prime minister relinquished her office after just 44 days of political and economic tumult, the shortest tenure in British history.
articles.abstract: The beleaguered British prime minister relinquished her office after just 44 days of political and economic tumult, the shortest tenure in British history.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Liz Truss of Britain announced her resignation on Thursday, bringing a swift end to a six-week stint in office that began with a radical experiment in trickle-down economics and descended into financial and political chaos, as most of those policies were reversed.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: After a Storm, Britain’s Economy Finds Itself Rudderless
articles.snippet: The departure of Prime Minister Liz Truss raises uncertainty in a country searching for answers to soaring inflation and stagnant growth.
articles.abstract: The departure of Prime Minister Liz Truss raises uncertainty in a country searching for answers to soaring inflation and stagnant growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fall of Liz Truss, Britain’s prime minister for just six tumultuous weeks, has plunged the nation into another phase of economic uncertainty.

articles.headline: As Inflation Stalks Europe, Leaders Shudder
articles.snippet: The downfall of Britain’s prime minister served as a warning to all of the political peril that awaits those who fail to address the erosion of living standards, no matter the cause.
articles.abstract: The downfall of Britain’s prime minister served as a warning to all of the political peril that awaits those who fail to address the erosion of living standards, no matter the cause.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME — The retired women wheeled their canvas shopping carts to the fresh pasta counter of an outdoor market in Rome this week and commiserated about how the price of tagliatelle, oranges, napkins, utility bills — you name it — had gone through the roof.

articles.headline: Airlines Cash In as Flexible Work Changes Travel Patterns
articles.snippet: Untethered from desks, passengers are flying more often and in different ways. Carriers expect the new habits to endure, despite economic uncertainty.
articles.abstract: Untethered from desks, passengers are flying more often and in different ways. Carriers expect the new habits to endure, despite economic uncertainty.
articles.lead_paragraph: Markets are convulsing, and inflation is squeezing consumers. But people are still flying. A lot.

articles.headline: Where $30 Billion to Fix Systemic Racism Actually Goes
articles.snippet: In 2020, JPMorgan pledged to invest significant resources in closing the racial wealth gap. Here is what the bank did, and what it looks like when a private-sector company tries to fix a societal problem.
articles.abstract: In 2020, JPMorgan pledged to invest significant resources in closing the racial wealth gap. Here is what the bank did, and what it looks like when a private-sector company tries to fix a societal problem.
articles.lead_paragraph: It seemed like a big number.

articles.headline: A Coming-Out Party for Generative A.I., Silicon Valley’s New Craze
articles.snippet: A celebration for Stability AI, the start-up behind the controversial Stable Diffusion image generator, represents the arrival of a new A.I. boom.
articles.abstract: A celebration for Stability AI, the start-up behind the controversial Stable Diffusion image generator, represents the arrival of a new A.I. boom.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Silicon Valley, crypto and the metaverse are out. Generative A.I. is in.

articles.headline: Why Japan Stands Virtually Alone in Keeping Interest Rates Ultralow
articles.snippet: The yen is plummeting and inflation is climbing, but Japan’s economic circumstances have led to a view that raising rates would do more harm than good.
articles.abstract: The yen is plummeting and inflation is climbing, but Japan’s economic circumstances have led to a view that raising rates would do more harm than good.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — As the Federal Reserve has repeatedly pushed up American interest rates in an effort to tame rampant inflation, virtually every major central bank in the world has scrambled to keep up the pace. And then there’s the Bank of Japan.

articles.headline: Hasta la Vista? This Time, Boris Johnson May Say, ‘I’m Back.’
articles.snippet: A comeback by Mr. Johnson is viewed as a very real possibility, delighting some Conservative Party lawmakers and repelling others.
articles.abstract: A comeback by Mr. Johnson is viewed as a very real possibility, delighting some Conservative Party lawmakers and repelling others.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It seemed at once incredible and inevitable.

articles.headline: As Britain’s Economy Stumbles, One Sector Is Booming: Whisky
articles.snippet: Scotch whisky exports have soared this year. The weak British pound could spur even more demand for single malt scotch.
articles.abstract: Scotch whisky exports have soared this year. The weak British pound could spur even more demand for single malt scotch.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain’s economy has been buffeted by the effects of Brexit, the war in Ukraine and, most recently, the government’s dramatic reversal on a series of planned tax cuts that led to the resignation of Prime Minister Liz Truss. But for Scotland’s whisky producers, business is booming, and the British pound’s precipitous decline against major currencies is providing an extra boost, making whisky more affordable for buyers outside of Britain.
articles.byline: By Jenny Gross and Kieran Dodds

articles.headline: Bannon Sentenced to 4 Months in Prison for Contempt of Congress
articles.snippet: Stephen Bannon was found guilty of two counts of contempt of Congress this summer for defying a subpoena from the House Jan. 6 committee.
articles.abstract: Stephen Bannon was found guilty of two counts of contempt of Congress this summer for defying a subpoena from the House Jan. 6 committee.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Stephen K. Bannon, a longtime adviser to former President Donald J. Trump who aided in the effort to overturn the 2020 election, was sentenced on Friday to four months in prison for disobeying a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer

articles.headline: In Shattered Homes, Ukrainians Brace for a Cold Winter
articles.snippet: In cities and towns battered by the war, residents worry about how to heat their homes as temperatures drop. But even in places spared from the worst of the fighting, Russian strikes on infrastructure have raised new fears.
articles.abstract: In cities and towns battered by the war, residents worry about how to heat their homes as temperatures drop. But even in places spared from the worst of the fighting, Russian strikes on infrastructure have raised new fears.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHERNIHIV, Ukraine — Near the front door of the second-floor apartment is a pile of blankets, just in case. Plastic sheeting covers the broken windows in the main bedroom. The lower half of the wall protrudes precariously out, seemingly ready to fall.
articles.byline: By Megan Specia and Brendan Hoffman
